subsection.name: Description
subsection.div:
Checks the header of a source file against a header that contains a
pattern for each line of the source header.

tr.td: Specify the character encoding to use when reading the headerFile.

td.code: the charset property of the parent Checker module

tr.td: Specify the file extensions of the files to process.

Define the required header specified inline. Individual header lines must be separated by the string "
" (even on platforms with a different line separator). For header lines containing "

" checkstyle will forcefully expect an empty line to exist. See examples below. Regular expressions must not span multiple lines.
Specify the name of the file containing the required header.
Specify the line numbers to repeat (zero or more times).

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check such that no violations arise. Default values of properties are used.
To configure the check to use header file "java.header" and 10 and 13 multi-lines:
subsection.source: <module name="Checker"> <module name="RegexpHeader"> <property name="headerFile" value="${config.folder}/java.header"/> <property name="multiLines" value="10, 13"/> </module> </module>
subsection.p: To configure the check to verify that each file starts with the header
subsection.source: <module name="Checker"> <module name="RegexpHeader"> <property name="header" value="^// Copyright \(C\) (\d\d\d\d -)? 2004 MyCompany$ \n^// All rights reserved$"/> </module> </module>
